Package edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.sorter

Class QuickSorter<E extends Comparable<E>>

java.lang.Object
edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.sorter.AbstractComparisonSorter<E>
edu.ncsu.csc316.dsa.sorter.QuickSorter<E>
Type Parameters:
E - the type of elements to sort; elements must be Comparable
All Implemented Interfaces:
Sorter<E>
public class QuickSorter<E extends Comparable<E>> extends AbstractComparisonSorter<E>
QuickSorter sorts arrays of comparable elements using the quicksort algorithm. This implementation allows the client to specify a specific pivot selection strategy: (a) use the first element as the pivot, (b) use the last element as the pivot, (c) use the middle element as the pivot, or (d) use an element at a random index as the pivot. Using the randomized pivot selection strategy ensures O(nlogn) expected/average case runtime when sorting n elements that are comparable
Author:
Dr. King

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    QuickSorter.FirstElementSelector
    FirstElementSelector chooses the first index of the array as the index of the pivot element that should be used when sorting
    static class 
    QuickSorter.LastElementSelector
    LastElementSelector selects the last element between to be used as the pivot element that will be used when sorting
    static class 
    QuickSorter.MiddleElementSelector
    MiddleElementSelector selects the middle element between low and high to be used as the pivot element that will be used when sorting
    static class 
    QuickSorter.RandomElementSelector
    RandomElementSelector selects a random element within high and low inclusive to be the pivot element that will be used when sorting

    Pivot selection strategy that uses the element at a randomly-chosen index each time a pivot must be selected
